Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures184514.Graph

    GraphADT

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphADT
    Class representation of a graph following the GraphADT interface provided

      • insertEdge

        public Edge insertEdge(Vertex u,
                       Vertex v,
                       java.lang.String n)
        Build a new edge with end vertices u and v and weight w and insert into the graph. NB: The vertices u and v must already be in the graph: I have ignored checking of error conditions for simplicity.
        Specified by:
        insertEdge in interface GraphADT
        Parameters:
        u - Vertex
        v - Vertex
        w - the weight of the new edge
        Returns:
        the new Edge

      • removeEdge

        public java.lang.String removeEdge(Edge e)
        Remove the edge e from the graph. The name of the old edge is returned (or null if the edge is not in the graph).
        Specified by:
        removeEdge in interface GraphADT
        Parameters:
        e - the edge to be removed
        Returns:
        int

      • bftraverse

        public void bftraverse(Vertex v)

      • allReachable

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> allReachable(Vertex v)
        Return a list of all of the vertices reachable from the given vertex V. Uses BFS to see which nodes are visited, so therefore reachable
        Parameters:
        Vertex - v
        Returns:
        an array list of vertices of all the vertices reached

      • bftraverse

        public void bftraverse()
        Perform a breadth-first search traversal of the graph. It works by iterating through the graph vertices and carrying out a bfs traversal for each unvisited vertex. This method has no parameters so starts on the first vertex of the vertex list

      • allConnected

        public boolean allConnected()
        Checks whether the whole graph is connected. Performs BFS of a graph and checks that all vertices have been visited. If there exists at least on unvisited vertex list the graph is not connected would return false
        Returns:
        true if the graph is connected, false if not connected

      • mostDirectRoute

        public java.util.ArrayList<Edge> mostDirectRoute(Vertex u,
                                                 Vertex v)
        BFS used to find the most direct route between u and v vertices given. Reconstructs the followed edge references, from the destination vertex v from u. The path itself is represented as an ArrayList of Edge objects. Will return null if no path between u and v
        Parameters:
        u - start vertex
        v - end vertex
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of edges

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the graph by 'unvisiting' (i.e. removing markings from) the vertices and edges. Called before fresh breadth-first traversal is carried out to ensure correct execution.
